definition: fifty cents (0.5 RMB)/(fig.) paltry sum of money/(abbr. for 五毛黨|五毛党[wu3 mao2 dang3]) hired Internet commenter

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
fifty cents party (person supposed to relay government propaganda on Internet sites)

sentences.english: Of course, but you will have to pay 50 cents for each local call.
sentences.chinese: 當然可以，不過每打一次當地的電話，你要付五毛錢。

sentences.english: There are no less than a dozen of such low lives on this CNN forum.
sentences.chinese: 在CNN論壇上就有不少於一打這麼多的五毛黨。

sentences.english: We also have half- dollar and one- dollar coins.
sentences.chinese: 我們還有五毛和一元的硬幣。

sentences.english: The term Fifty Cent Party, or wumaodang, was born.
You always look phone numbers up in the phone book, since calling Information costs 50 cents.
sentences.chinese: 你總是查電話薄，因爲電話號碼查詢會花費五毛錢。

sentences.english: Four point five Yuan in all.
Leo made a soup from stone which is flavor.
sentences.chinese: 五毛引導大家煮了一鍋石頭湯。

sentences.english: You 50 Fen we can piece I five hair.
sentences.chinese: 你五毛我五毛咱們就能一塊了。

sentences.english: You 50 Fen we can piece I five hair.
sentences.chinese: 你五毛我五毛咱們就能一塊了。

definition: one yuan or less/around 80 cents or one dollar
spicy sticks, a snack food similar to beef jerky but made with flour or dried beancurd instead of meat
tea egg (egg boiled with flavorings which may include black tea)
aw, fuck! (loanword from Korean 아! 씨발!)
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
